properties.title: Buckby Library & Hub

properties.address: 23, RUGBY, Warwickshire CV21 2SD CV21 2SD
properties.description: We cater for everyone, including the elderly. We are a multicultural space and have some free and easy exercises available. Gentle pilates, table tennis and snooker and some low level Aerobics. We are also a CAP job club, and will be able to help with Job search issues and signposting advice for housing financial matters. We provide a warm drink an sometimes warm soup and rolls.
properties.title: Harvest Fellowship Hub

properties.title: Refresh

properties.address: Little Elborow Street, Rugby , Warwickshire CV21 3BZ
properties.description: Mondays 10am -12 - Join us in our living room area for refreshments, company, games & puzzles, craft materials, free Wi-Fi and occasional talks and workshops Tuesdays 1.15-3.15 pm - The Yarn Crafters drop-in group welcomes crocheters, knitters, or other yarn crafters from beginners to advanced. Bring along your own project or help us with ours. We have a supply of yarn, needles, hooks etc. Socialise, share your knowledge and get creative. Refreshments included. Thursdays 10am -12 - Stop by for a friendly game of chess. E﻿njoy the world's favourite abstract strategy game and meet fellow players Refreshments provided. Drop-in event, no need to book. Full range of library services available during opening hours with a programme of free activities for children and families. See also the library facebook page: www.facebook.com/rugbylibrary
properties.title: Rugby Library & Information Service

properties.address: St. Andrews Parish Church, Warwickshire CV21 3PT
properties.description: The church is open to all Monday to Friday 9.30am - 2pm, Saturday until 12noon. We have a cafe, children's area, toilets, weekly concert at 1pm on Tuesday and groups to join.
properties.title: St Andrew's Church

properties.address: St. Mary's Church, Lutterworth, Leicestershire LE17 4AN
properties.description: The church cafe is open for visitors from 10am-midday (Tuesday to Saturday) for a warm drink, a friendly chat, or simply to have a look at some of the building’s history. We're open on Sundays for our 11am informal service. Donations towards your drink or biscuit are accepted, but not necessary. We'd love to welcome you! We also have plenty of toys available for young children and are able to take referrals for the Lutterworth and Villages Foodbank.
properties.title: St Mary's Church Lutterworth

properties.address: Cawston Community Hall, Scholars Drive, Cawston, CV22 7GU
properties.description: Coffee Morning. Entrance is free! £2 for a hot drink (or squash) and a biscuit and this includes a free refill. Everyone is welcome – we encourage a broad spectrum of people and provide a children’s corner. Most sessions will have music or a raffle or both! The Police and local authority representatives are often present so visitors can can chat them informally in a relaxed setting. Any profit made on the day goes towards a nominated charity.
